question: How do I know which type of lesson is right for me?
answer: The best type of lesson depends on your goals, learning style, and budget. Individual lessons offer personalized attention and faster progress, while group lessons provide more conversation practice and are more economical. We recommend booking a free consultation where we can discuss your needs and recommend the most suitable option.

question: What levels of English proficiency do you teach?
answer: We work with students at all proficiency levels, from complete beginners (A1) to advanced fluency (C2). During your first session, we'll assess your current level and design a learning path tailored to your needs and goals.

question: How long does it typically take to improve my English level?
answer: Progress varies depending on your starting level, learning goals, frequency of lessons, and how much you practice outside of class. Many students report noticeable improvement in specific areas (like conversation or writing) within 1-2 months of regular lessons. Advancing a full proficiency level (e.g., from B1 to B2) typically takes 3-6 months of consistent study.

question: Do you offer lessons on weekends or evenings?
answer: Yes, we understand that many students have work or school commitments during regular business hours. We offer flexible scheduling with lessons available on weekends and evenings (up to 9 PM local time) to accommodate different time zones and schedules.

question: What happens if I need to cancel or reschedule a lesson?
answer: We have a 24-hour cancellation policy. If you cancel more than 24 hours before your scheduled lesson, you can reschedule at no cost. Cancellations with less than 24 hours' notice will be charged the full lesson fee, except in cases of genuine emergency which we handle on a case-by-case basis.

question: What materials or textbooks will I need?
answer: All essential learning materials are provided as part of your lessons. These include digital worksheets, exercises, and resources tailored to your learning goals. For some specialized courses, we might recommend optional textbooks or resources, but these are never required to participate in our lessons.

question: Can I try a lesson before committing to a package?
answer: Absolutely! We offer a free 30-minute consultation that includes a level assessment and lesson sample. This gives you a chance to experience our teaching style and discuss your goals before making any commitment. If you prefer, you can also book a single full-length lesson before deciding on a larger package.

question: How do online lessons work?
answer: Online lessons take place via Zoom or similar video conferencing platforms. You'll receive a link before your scheduled lesson time. Our digital classroom features screen sharing for lesson materials, collaborative documents, an interactive whiteboard, and more. All you need is a stable internet connection, a device with a camera and microphone, and a quiet place to focus.

question: Do you prepare students for specific English exams like IELTS or TOEFL?
answer: Yes, we offer specialized exam preparation courses for all major English proficiency tests including IELTS, TOEFL, Cambridge exams (FCE, CAE, CPE), and PTE. Our tutors are familiar with the format and requirements of these exams and can provide targeted practice and strategies to maximize your score.

question: What payment methods do you accept?
answer: We accept credit/debit cards, PayPal, bank transfers, and major digital payment platforms. All payments are processed securely through our website. For packages, you can either pay the full amount upfront or choose our installment option for larger packages.
